definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Three visualisations of nuclear combustion in a supernova.
sentences.chinese: 超新星內核燃燒的三種清晰呈像。

sentences.english: That we have to try to bring new stars to the lights, so to speak.
sentences.chinese: 可以這麼說，我們必須儘量吸引新星來我們國家。

sentences.english: Astronomers say the newly-found planet lies in the middle of what's referred to as the habitable or Goldilocks zone.
sentences.chinese: 天文學家說這顆新星處在稱爲可居住區的中間。

sentences.english: Historiography in the 20th century's most dazzling star of the Annales school in France.
sentences.chinese: 20世紀史學中最耀眼的新星是法國的年鑑學派。

sentences.english: Huang Gang is the rising reporter star during the War of Resistance against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 黃鋼是中國抗日戰爭中升起的一顆記者新星。
然後，它們像超新星一樣爆炸。

sentences.english: Mind Over Money, right now on NOVA.
sentences.chinese: 心靈的錢，現在就一顆新星。

sentences.english: Selentsov said only this way could bring the "New Star" to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 塞倫特索夫稱，只有這樣才能使“新星號”停船。

sentences.english: It comes from observations of supernovae and other very distant sources.
sentences.chinese: 而是來自遙遠的超新星和其他非常遠的源。

sentences.english: Indeed, novas and so on Qiao liberal arts are especially the article arrogant capital.
sentences.chinese: 的確，喬文科等新星都是尤文驕傲的資本。

sentences.english: The brightest supernova in 400 years resembles a cosmic string of pearls.
sentences.chinese: 最亮的超新星在400年內類似於一串宇宙珍珠。

sentences.english: Polarimetric observations of Nova Cygni 1975 are presented.
sentences.chinese: 對1975年天鵝座新星進行了偏振測光。

sentences.english: Brazil coach Dunga has declared AC Milan youngster Alexandre Pato as the 'new Ronaldo'.
sentences.chinese: 巴西主教練鄧加認爲米蘭新星帕託是“新羅納爾多”。

sentences.english: Here are some of the latest sensations. See what it takes to become famous.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們看看以下的網絡新星都是以什麼方式成名的吧。

sentences.english: The matter from the explosion will eventually form new stars and planets.
sentences.chinese: 此次爆炸產生的物質最終會形成一些新星和星球。

definition: (in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
(astronomy) giant star/(fig.) superstar (of opera, basketball etc)
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
newcomer/fresh talent/newlywed, esp. new bride/bride and groom
Mesozoic (geological era 250-65m years ago, covering Triassic 三疊紀|三叠纪, Jurassic 侏羅紀|侏罗纪 and Cretaceous 白堊紀|白垩纪)
lit. old general/commander-in-chief 將帥|将帅, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess/fig. old-timer/veteran
leading (role)/heading list of signatories/leading actors (in a show)/starring
